snippet.title: HYBE becomes top shareholder of SM Entertainment
snippet.description:
하이브, 이수만 손잡고 SM 인수 K팝 공룡 기획사 탄생

Korean entertainment giant HYBE is on course to become an even greater K-POP powerhouse.
As BTS agency becomes the largest shareholder of rival SM Entertainment.
Lee Eun-jin has the details.

HYBE is the Korean entertainment agency behind global K-pop phenomenon BTS.
On Friday, the agency was officially confirmed to be acquiring a 14-point-8 percent stake in its rival K-pop agency SM Entertainment, by signing a deal with SM's founder Lee Soo-man.
 Lee sold 14-point-8 percent of his 18-point-4-6 percent holdings.
The deal would make Hybe the largest shareholder.
SM Entertainment is one of the country's top K-pop agencies, behind big-name groups like EXO, Red Velvet, NCT and aespa.
The latest move creates a new monster K-pop power, that will be taking K-pop to new heights.

Earlier this week, on Tuesday, Kakao struck a deal with SM Entertainment to acquire a 9-point-zero-5 percent stake.
But HYBE's 334-point-3 million U.S. dollar deal with founder and longtime producer Lee Soo-man was the single move making HYBE the new top stakeholder.

HYBE called this latest deal a game-changer for the impact K-pop will have in the global music industry.
SM Entertainment was behind the first generation "Hallyu" stars like H-O-T and Boa and by becoming their biggest shareholder, HYBE hopes to take global recognition of K-pop to new heights.
On Thursday, HYBE's American unit signed a deal to acquire a 100-percent stake in QC Media Holdings, the parent company of an influential U.S.-based hip-hop label Quality Control Music.
As HYBE expands its global business portfolio, its jump into the global market is also expected to reach even more fans.
Lee Eunjin, Arirang News.

#HYBE #SM_Entertainment #Arirang_News

📣 Twitter : https://twitter.com/arirangtvnews
📣 Homepage : https://v2.arirang.com/


2023-02-10, 12:00 (KST)
